title: David
comment: The youngest son of Jesse and great-grandson of Ruth and Boaz, who became Israel's greatest king. Born in the town of Bethlehem, he probably lived c. 1040-970 B.C.

children.title: David, rise of
children.comment: David rose from humble origins to become Israel's greatest king. His rise to power is seen by OT writers as evidence of God's guiding hand upon both David and Israel.

children.title: David was the great-grandson of Ruth and Boaz
David was anointed king by Samuel
David was a member of Saul's court
The relationship between David and Saul
David, reign of
children.comment: David reigned over Judah for seven and a half years and over all Israel for 33 years. He extended the kingdom to the boundaries promised by God to Joshua.

children.title: David reigned over Judah in Hebron

David, character of
children.comment: David, although not perfect, is portrayed as a man and a king after God's own heart.

children.title: His respect for those in authority
His deep humanity is evident in his paternal grief
He was a strategist and courageous commander
He was a musician and poet
His military activities prevented him from building the temple
His adultery with Bathsheba and murder of Uriah
David, significance of
children.comment: David was instrumental in the establishment of Jerusalem as the centre of Israel's worship. Through David's personal rule, God exercised his own kingship over his people. David thus foreshadowed the Messiah, who would spring from his royal line.
